name: phlox glaberrima subsp. interior
description: Also called Smooth Phlox for its smooth, hairless stem. It very much resembles Phlox pilosa (Prairie Phlox) if not for this smooth stem.  Prairie Phlox does bloom earlier, has a shorter stature, and needs drier soil.  Like all Phlox species, Marsh Phlox will attract many types of butterflies, moths and bees.  As its name suggests, it does grow best in moist soils.  Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
